verses.text_plain: When I would have healed Israel, then the iniquity of Ephraim was discovered, and the wickedness of Samaria: for they commit falsehood; and the thief cometh in, and the troop of robbers spoileth without.
verses.verse_html:
1When I would have healed Israel, then the iniquity of Ephraim was discovered, and the wickedness of Samaria: for they commit falsehood; and the thief cometh in, and the troop of robbers spoileth without. ▼
▼ wickedness: Heb. evils
 , ▼
▼ spoileth: Heb. strippeth

verses.text_plain: And they consider not in their hearts that I remember all their wickedness: now their own doings have beset them about; they are before my face.
verses.verse_html:
2And they consider not in their hearts that I remember all their wickedness: now their own doings have beset them about; they are before my face. ▼
▼ consider…: Heb. say not to

footnotes.body_html: ▼ consider…: Heb. say not to

verses.text_plain: They make the king glad with their wickedness, and the princes with their lies.
verses.verse_html: 3They make the king glad with their wickedness, and the princes with their lies.

verses.text_plain: They are all adulterers, as an oven heated by the baker, who ceaseth from raising after he hath kneaded the dough, until it be leavened.
verses.verse_html:
4They are all adulterers, as an oven heated by the baker, who ceaseth from raising after he hath kneaded the dough, until it be leavened. ▼
▼ who…: or, the raiser will cease
 , ▼
▼ raising: or, waking

footnotes.body_text: ▼ who…: or, the raiser will cease
footnotes.body_html: ▼ who…: or, the raiser will cease

verses.text_plain: In the day of our king the princes have made him sick with bottles of wine; he stretched out his hand with scorners.
verses.verse_html:
5In the day of our king the princes have made him sick with bottles of wine; he stretched out his hand with scorners. ▼
▼ bottles…: or, heat through wine

footnotes.body_html: ▼ bottles…: or, heat through wine

verses.text_plain: For they have made ready their heart like an oven, whiles they lie in wait: their baker sleepeth all the night; in the morning it burneth as a flaming fire.
verses.verse_html:
6For they have made ready their heart like an oven, whiles they lie in wait: their baker sleepeth all the night; in the morning it burneth as a flaming fire. ▼
▼ made…: or, applied

verses.text_plain: They are all hot as an oven, and have devoured their judges; all their kings are fallen: there is none among them that calleth unto me.
verses.verse_html: 7They are all hot as an oven, and have devoured their judges; all their kings are fallen: there is none among them that calleth unto me.

verses.text_plain: Ephraim, he hath mixed himself among the people; Ephraim is a cake not turned.
verses.verse_html: 8Ephraim, he hath mixed himself among the people; Ephraim is a cake not turned.

verses.text_plain: Strangers have devoured his strength, and he knoweth it not: yea, gray hairs are here and there upon him, yet he knoweth not.
verses.verse_html:
9Strangers have devoured his strength, and he knoweth it not: yea, gray hairs are here and there upon him, yet he knoweth not. ▼
▼ here…: Heb. sprinkled

verses.text_plain: And the pride of Israel testifieth to his face: and they do not return to the Lord their God, nor seek him for all this.
verses.verse_html: 10And the pride of Israel testifieth to his face: and they do not return to the Lord their God, nor seek him for all this.

verses.text_plain: Ephraim also is like a silly dove without heart: they call to Egypt, they go to Assyria.
verses.verse_html: 11Ephraim also is like a silly dove without heart: they call to Egypt, they go to Assyria.

verses.text_plain: When they shall go, I will spread my net upon them; I will bring them down as the fowls of the heaven; I will chastise them, as their congregation hath heard.
verses.verse_html: 12When they shall go, I will spread my net upon them; I will bring them down as the fowls of the heaven; I will chastise them, as their congregation hath heard.

tokens.text: upon them; I will bring them down

verses.text_plain: Woe unto them! for they have fled from me: destruction unto them! because they have transgressed against me: though I have redeemed them, yet they have spoken lies against me.
verses.verse_html:
13Woe unto them! for they have fled from me: destruction unto them! because they have transgressed against me: though I have redeemed them, yet they have spoken lies against me. ▼
▼ destruction: Heb. spoil

tokens.text: unto them! for they have fled
unto them! because they have transgressed
against me: though I have redeemed

verses.text_plain: And they have not cried unto me with their heart, when they howled upon their beds: they assemble themselves for corn and wine, and they rebel against me.
verses.verse_html: 14And they have not cried unto me with their heart, when they howled upon their beds: they assemble themselves for corn and wine, and they rebel against me.

verses.text_plain: Though I have bound and strengthened their arms, yet do they imagine mischief against me.
verses.verse_html:
15Though I have bound and strengthened their arms, yet do they imagine mischief against me. ▼
▼ have…: or, chastened

verses.text_plain: They return, but not to the most High: they are like a deceitful bow: their princes shall fall by the sword for the rage of their tongue: this shall be their derision in the land of Egypt.
verses.verse_html: 16They return, but not to the most High: they are like a deceitful bow: their princes shall fall by the sword for the rage of their tongue: this shall be their derision in the land of Egypt.
